edu.monash.fit2099.engine

Class MoveActorAction

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.monash.fit2099.engine.Action
      • edu.monash.fit2099.engine.MoveActorAction

  • public class MoveActorAction
extends Action
    An Action that moves the Actor.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      MoveActorAction(Location moveToLocation, java.lang.String direction)
      Constructor to create an Action that will move the Actor to a Location in a given Direction.
      MoveActorAction(Location moveToLocation, java.lang.String direction, java.lang.String hotKey)
      Constructor to create an Action that will move the Actor to a Location in a given Direction, using a given menu hotkey.

    • Constructor Detail

      • MoveActorAction

        public MoveActorAction(Location moveToLocation,
                       java.lang.String direction,
                       java.lang.String hotKey)
        Constructor to create an Action that will move the Actor to a Location in a given Direction, using a given menu hotkey. Note that this constructor does not check whether the supplied Location is actually in the given direction from the Actor's current location. This allows for (e.g.) teleporters, etc.
        Parameters:
        moveToLocation - the destination of the move
        direction - the direction of the move (to be displayed in menu)
        hotKey - the menu hotkey for this move

      • MoveActorAction

        public MoveActorAction(Location moveToLocation,
                       java.lang.String direction)
        Constructor to create an Action that will move the Actor to a Location in a given Direction. A currently-unused menu hotkey will be assigned. Note that this constructor does not check whether the supplied Location is actually in the given direction from the Actor's current location. This allows for (e.g.) teleporters, etc.
        Parameters:
        moveToLocation - Location to move to
        direction - String describing the direction to move in, e.g. "north"

    • Method Detail

                                GameMap map)
        Allow the Actor to be moved. Overrides Action.execute()
        Specified by:
        execute in class Action
        Parameters:
        actor - The actor performing the action.
        map - The map the actor is on.
        Returns:
        a description of the Action suitable for the menu
        See Also:

      • menuDescription

        public java.lang.String menuDescription(Actor actor)
        Returns a description of this movement suitable to display in the menu.
        Specified by:

        Parameters:

        Returns:
